title: After School Programs in the Mission
name: After School Programs in the Mission

properties.name: 7 Tepees
properties.descrption: Seven Tepees Youth Program works with youth in grades 6-12, providing support with an emphsasis on social competency, self-esteem, academics, the natural environment, and preparing for future success. 7 Tepees pairs mentors with kids to build strong, stable relationships. 7 Tepees usually has a waiting list for all grades.

properties.name: 826 Valencia
properties.descrption: 826 Valencia has trained tutors to help students with homework, creative writing, expository writing, or English skills. Students have to be enrolled to attend the after school tutoring, but there is drop-in tutoring on Sundays open to all.

properties.name: Mission Girls
properties.descrption: Mission Girls work with Latina girls ages 9-14 in a number of personal enrichment programs, and meets Monday through Friday, 3-6pm.

properties.name: Boys & Girls Club, Mission
properties.descrption: Like any other Boys & Girls Club, the Mission branch offers a wealth of activities. Membership is open to kids 6-18 and costs $10 for the year. The club is open Monday-Friday after school and in the evening.

properties.name: Boys & Girls Club, Columbia Park
properties.descrption: Like any other Boys & Girls Club, the Columbia Park branch offers a wealth of activities. Membership is open to kids 6-18 and costs $10 for the year. The club is open Monday-Friday after school and in the evening.

properties.name: San Francisco Public Library, Mission Branch
properties.descrption: The Mission Branch of the SF Public Library offers free homework to anyone who needs it, Tuesdays-Thursdays.

properties.name: Horizons Unlimited
properties.descrption: Horizons offers a broad range of programs and services, including music and employment programs, that are designed to meet the diverse needs of youth.

properties.name: Community Music Center
properties.descrption: The Community Music Center offers several different programs for youth, including a children's chorus and a teens' chorus, and instruction in numerous instruments and styles including jazz, Latin and classical.

properties.name: Mission Learning Center
properties.descrption: The Mission Learning Center helps children who read below grade level increase their literacy skills. Meets Monday-Thursday.

properties.name: Precita Valley Community Center
properties.descrption: The Precita Valley Community Center offers a wealth of programs and support to youth, including GED classes, gender specific leadership classes, health education and violence prevention, among many others.

properties.name: Mission Graduates
properties.descrption: Mission Graduates offer a plethora of activities directly within Mission schools, but also provides onsite parental support to get parents involved with their children's education.

properties.name: Mission Education Project Inc.
properties.descrption: MEPI helps students improve their math and English skills. MEPI also holds parent workshops that focus on confidence building and being proactive in their child's education.

properties.name: Mission Cultural Center for Latino Arts
properties.descrption: The Mission Cultural Center for Latino Arts provides classes to youth such as Capoeira and Tae Kwon Do.

properties.name: Mission Recreation Center
properties.descrption: San Francisco Rec and Parks offers numerous after school programs involving arts and sports for youth of all ages. Check their current seasonal schedule for up-to-date classes.

properties.name: Salvation Army Mission Corps
properties.descrption: The Mission Branch of the Salvation Army offers a variety of games, programs and homework help to youth Monday-Friday, 2:00-6:00pm.

properties.name: The Vision Academy
properties.descrption: The Vision Academy is a new program that works with kids in small groups, combining tutoring with chess and educational games on iPads.

properties.name: The Marsh Theatre
properties.descrption: The Marsh provides youth of any ability and financial limitation to experience the integration of music, dance, drama, stagecraft and performance into one holistic program. Check their website for current class schedules.

properties.name: Good Samaritan Family Resource Center
properties.descrption: Other than providing programs directly to Mission schools, Good Samaritan Family Resource Center works on-site with high schoolers every Friday, promoting leadership and cultural enrichment. They also work with parents to help them get involved with their child's education.
